page.title: 12Life In Bury-1920's. Jayne
page.content: Mr. B. was born in a house in Cannon St. He had no bathroom, his family used a tin bath in front of the fire which was made from coal. There was no central heating. The only water tap was in the yard and 12 families had to share it. The toilet was outside the house too. Some homes had gas lights and some people used parafin lamps. Everyone used candles. They were very cheap. The outskirts of Bury were: East.....Hollow Rd. South....The gaol in Sicklesmere Rd. West.....The Spread Eagle Inn. North....The Tollgate Inn. The town was completely surrounded by fields. It was quiet and children could play in the streets safely because there was very little traffic. There were few car parks and no Traffic Wardens.
